title: 103_hr1123
content:
The "FHA Modernization Act" may be cited as the short title for this Act. It includes provisions related to the FHA computer system. The Secretary of Housing and Urban Development will select a computer system for administering housing mortgage insurance programs. The system will be chosen from commercially available options and used for processing mortgage applications effectively. The Secretary of Housing and Urban Development will contract with a private entity to use a computer system for administering housing mortgage insurance programs. The system must meet specified requirements for processing applications and maintaining records. The Secretary of Housing and Urban Development contracts a private entity to use a computer system for administering mortgage insurance programs, including maintaining records, facilitating interactions with mortgagees, monitoring performance, and overseeing entities involved in the programs. The Secretary of Housing and Urban Development contracts a private entity to administer mortgage insurance programs, including overseeing entities involved in the programs. Approved mortgagees for direct endorsement are also under the purview of the Secretary. The Secretary of Housing and Urban Development contracts a private entity to administer insurance programs using computer systems. The Secretary will conduct a study on utilizing private contractors to administer housing mortgage insurance programs under the National Housing Act. A report with findings and recommendations on the use and cost of private contractors must be submitted to Congress within 4 months. The Secretary will establish performance standards for evaluating the Department of Housing and Urban Development's functions in the housing mortgage insurance programs. This includes standards for application processing, record accuracy, fund accounting, delinquency handling, and other program functions. Additionally, periodic reports on contractor performance will be required. SEC. 5. PERIODIC REPORTS REGARDING CONTRACTOR PERFORMANCE.

The Secretary will submit annual reports to Congress on the performance of mortgagees, servicers, and contractors involved in housing mortgage insurance programs. Reports must be submitted by March 31 of the following year.

SEC. 6. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS.

$10,000,000 is authorized for fiscal year 1994 to carry out this Act.
